body:
Hey,
thank you for submitting the first issue :) 
Just to let you know the part of log you copied is from 2017-05-07, you should've copied the bottom part.
Anyway, in this particular case it looks all good from the logs point of view. There are some exceptions thrown and caught in viewmodel which shouldn't crash VS.
I think we should look at ActivityLog.xml file.
Could you start VS with /log flag, then reproduce the crash and check the content of ActivityLog.xml file?
More info how to generate and find it here: https://msdn.microsoft.com/pl-pl/library/ms241272.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396

Thank you for submitting the issue.
Yes, I agree that it looks terribly with Dark Theme. I'll try to figure out if there is a way to use VS themes. Regarding the second request at a first glance it should be easy to implement. I'll include these changes with side-by-side diff feature together.

It seems like it's using System.Reactive.Linq 2.2.5 instead of System.Reactive.Linq 2.3.0. I'll look at this when I get home.
Hey again @robertgadach ,
it's really hard to find a solution because I can't reproduce it on my machine.
could you do me a favour and uninstall github extensions for a while and then check if the same issue occurs? It seems like they use System.Reactive.Linq 2.2.5 which conflicts with our version. In the meantime I'll try to fix that by using ProvideCodeBase but I'm not 100% sure how exactly it works.
Edit2:  I've just made a fix with ProvideCodeBase. Could you please download this Vsix file and let me know if it solves the issue? (You can then ignore the above part)
[GitClientVS.VisualStudio.UI.zip](https://github.com/MistyKuu/bitbucket-for-visual-studio/files/1030083/GitClientVS.VisualStudio.UI.zip)

Here is the change: https://github.com/MistyKuu/bitbucket-for-visual-studio/compare/fix/dependencyissue?expand=1
The same issue: #5
Deployed in version 1.35.1. Please let me know guys if it helped.

Seems like a deployment bug after fix made on Friday. I will look at this this evening and the fix should be deployed today.
Edit: Hey @agrynco.
I've made a fix which should be available in 1.35.2 however this is because one of your extensions is conflicting with my extension and it's kinda tough to reproduce it on my machine. Could you please the new version and let me know if it helped?

@agrynco any update on that?
Edit: Closed due to lack of info. Please reopen it if it hasn't been fixed.

Hey Dan,
Please attach the log located under %AppData%\GitClientVsExtension\logs.txt. I'll investigate it further later today.
Edit: I'm pretty sure that 'size' property is not even used but it was int instead of long.
Here is the fix: https://github.com/MistyKuu/bitbucket-for-visual-studio/commit/59d42279cd2242966b77021abe3df68ebd2b922f

I'll release it when I finish making changes for diff view.

I was going to attach the file.

[logs.txt](https://github.com/MistyKuu/bitbucket-for-visual-studio/files/1050505/logs.txt)
@MistyKuu Should I make a new post?
No,  I have fixed it already.  You can see the commit in the previous post.  I just haven't released it yet.
Oh ok well thanks. I'm with a company, Onsolve, and I have some of the engineers waiting on me to let them know when this is working. So you've got people using it when it's ready!

@DanJ210 Cool! I've just released under 1.35.3 for you guys. It should be visible shortly in the marketplace. Please let me know if it fixed the issue.
By the way remember that you can always clone it using git and then choose is as active repository in Team Explorer to take advantage of other features.

1. Colors have been changed to match VS themes however I had to get rid of syntax highlighting because it didn't look well for some formats i.e xml.
2. I've also added Side by Side diff, built in feature from VS - it contains changes highlighting on word level. 
3. I've also tried to add word highlighting in Inline diff view but without a success so I will have to do it in the nearest future.

The changes will be deployed in the next version.
Edit: Deployed in 1.36.
Deployed in 1.36.
Closing because app passwords solve it quite easily: https://blog.bitbucket.org/2016/06/06/app-passwords-bitbucket-cloud/

Hey Dmytro,
is this Bitbucket Cloud or Bitbucket server?
Apologies for leaving this out in the first place - that's BitBucket Server. Is there's something I could do locally to help you identify the potential problem?

This is one of the features which I've been planning to implement. To display inline diff view I use AvalonEdit control which is quite flexible and shouldn't be that hard to add this functionality. This has to be phased like you suggested, the first version will allow you to enter just plain text and later it can be extended. I'll play with it probably in the next week.

I'm afraid that there is a cap. Look at pull request diff endpoint:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/bitbucket-server/4.13.0/bitbucket-rest.html#idm45295356631136

And quote:

> Note: This RESTful endpoint is currently not paged. The server will internally apply a hard cap to the streamed lines, and it is not possible to request subsequent pages if that cap is exceeded.

It looks like I'll have to try another way e.g. generate it from commits between branches.

> It looks like I'll have to try another way e.g. generate it from commits between branches.

Hmm, I would probably be careful here in order to avoid creating an excessive load on the server. Now that you have quoted the hard cap on the API side, I am inclined to think this was introduced for a reason. 

I would probably just say that it was really an edge case of misusing the pull request feature that prompted this issue in the first place, so on second thought I would "de-prio" it given the new knowledge. But of course it's totally up to you to decide :)

I started looking at it and I can't reproduce this issue. 
I have 1k files changed, every file has between 1-100 characters added and still I'm getting the entire response. Is there anything specific in your scenario?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10333668/27802156-51ba101e-6022-11e7-97f1-af1a54d994de.png)
Closing. Couldn't reproduce.

At a first glance this is caused by line 25 here:

https://github.com/MistyKuu/bitbucket-for-visual-studio/blob/develop/Source/BitBucket.REST.API/Mappings/Converters/EnterpriseLinksTypeConverter.cs

When you login it tries to call endpoint get recent repositories to check the connection. It looks like one of your recent repositories doesn't have clone URL containing 'http' endpoint. Is it possible that bitbucket repository doesn't have it? This is definitely a bug anyway because in this particular case it shouldn't fail because connection is established. As for now you can cheat and login to your bitbucket web page and get rid of that repository from the list. It will have to be fixed in the incoming release.

Deleted the complete repo in our bitbucket. 
Still getting this error. 
The Endpoint for the api also gives a 404..
Can I add this endpoint in a configuration.

Sorry I don't understand. After removing all repositories now it gives 404?
While logged in to bitbucket webpage please put it in the browser: http://bitbucket.tui.nl:49455/rest/api/1.0/profile/recent/repos and copy the json response here

This are 2 separate things. 

1. When i try to connect to the rest api in my browser i get an 404,

2. I deleted the repo. then tried to login with the extension i got the same error.
If you put this url in the browser and you get 404 then it means that your endpoint isn't valid.
I know..
